newsitem.title: USA: Ohio wheat development late but condition improves.
newsitem.headline: Ohio wheat development late but condition improves.

text.p: Winter wheat development in Ohio was behind normal as of Sunday, according to the Ohio Agricultural Statistics Service.
Nine percent of the crop was turning color, down from 23 percent last year and a five-year average of 45 percent. The report said the crop was 10 days behind average.
Winter wheat was rated 63 percent good to excellent, up from 56 percent a week earlier.
Corn condition also improved to 59 percent good to excellent, up from 53 percent a week earlier. Emergence had reached 98 percent, versus an average of 95 percent.
"The average corn development for the state is three or four leaves fully emerged," the report said.
Soybean planting was 95 percent complete, up from 88 percent a week earlier and up from a normal 93 percent.
Emergence was marginally behind normal at 82 percent versus 83 percent. Soybeans were rated 53 percent good or excellent, up from 48 percent a week earlier.
